title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A political allegory in the form of a fable, depicting a group of farm animals who overthrow their human farmer, only to face a new tyranny among themselves.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel following Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager navigating the adult world with cynicism and emotional struggle.

title: Lolita
author: Vladimir Nabokov
description: A controversial and haunting novel told from the perspective of Humbert Humbert, exploring obsession, manipulation, and morality.

title: It Ends With Us
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A poignant romance about love, strength, and making difficult choices, as Lily Bloom navigates a complicated relationship with her past and present.

title: November 9
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A romantic drama about two people who meet on the same date every year and must decide if their annual encounters are enough to sustain love.

title: Hopeless
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A deeply emotional story of secrets, trauma, and unexpected love, centered around Sky and the mysterious Holder.

title: Losing Hope
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A companion to Hopeless told from Holder’s perspective, revealing his side of the story and the emotional depth behind his choices.

title: All Your Perfects
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A raw and emotional exploration of a marriage on the brink, revealing how love and regret coexist through time.

title: Romeo and Juliet
author: William Shakespeare
description: A tragic play about two young star-crossed lovers whose deaths ultimately reconcile their feuding families.

title: Wonder
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A heartwarming story of August Pullman, a boy with facial differences who navigates public school for the first time, teaching others about kindness, empathy, and acceptance.
